document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
acuta Adams (1903:222
fem./male desc.),
Aldrich (1905:246
cat.),
Kröber (1912: 224
male key, 225 fem. key, 227 spec.

subSubSection.paragraph:
list; 1913:28 dist., 39 male /fem. key),
Cole (1923a: 34
male key, 37 fem. key, 70 note, Figs. 57 fem. frons, 67 wing,

Diagnosis. Diagnostic characteristic separating this species from
Litolinga tergisa
are given in the key to species.

Head. Length 0.80–1.02, 0.92 mm . Ocellar tubercle dark reddish brown, pubescence brownish gray, dense; setae black, short. Frons pubescence brownish gray, dense with whitish brown pubescence dorsolateral to antennal base and small dark brown area ventrolateral along eye margin. Antenna with scape and pedicel dark yellow, first flagellomere brown with apical third dark yellow, second and third flagellomeres dark brown; antenna/head length 0.63–0.75, 0.69; scape length 0.16–0.18, 0.17 mm , width 0.12–0.20, 0.15 mm , length/width 0.9–1.5, 1.2, scape/pedicel length 1.8–2.7, 2.2, scape/flagellum width 0.9–1.4, 0.9, setae dark brown grading into dark brown macrosetae, short; pedicel length 0.06–0.09, 0.08 mm , width 0.12–0.14, 0.13 mm , length/width 0.50–0.75, 0.62; flagellum length 0.23–0.40, 0.36 mm , width 0.14–0.18, 0.16 mm , length/ width 2.0–2.7, 2.3, flagellum/scape length 1.8–2.4, 2.1. Parafacial pubescence dark yellowish brown, dark brown pubescent band across dorsal fourth of parafacial. Maxillary palpus dark brown; length 0.34–0.52, 0.44 mm , width 0.08–0.10, 0.09 mm , length/width 4.0–5.6, 4.7; setae dark brown, elongate. Gena dark brown, white posteriorly, projecting ventrally, setae dark brown, short, white, elongate on posterior half.

Thorax. Macrosetae 2–4 np, 1–2 sa, 1 pa, 0 dc, 1 sc. Mesonotum dull brownish gray; setae dark brown, short, erect, sparse with white elongate, appressed setae. Pleuron pubescence gray, dense with faint dark brown dorsal margin; setae white, elongate on propleuron, anepisternum, katepisternum (occasionally sparse), laterotergite, and scutellum. Wing. Membrane pale brownish gray with pale gray areas within cells, veins brown with brown spot or margin at fork of R 4+5 , r–m, apex and base of discal cell, apex of cells bm and cup , and on veins R 2+3 , R 4 , R 5 , M 1 , M 2 , M 3 , CuA 1 , and A 1 +CuA 2 ; length 5.2–6.5, 5.8 mm , width 1.8–2.3, 2.0 mm, length/width 2.6–3.1, 2.9; pterostigma dark brown. Legs. Coxae pubescence white, dense; setae white, elongate. Femora brown; ventral setae dark brown. Tibiae pale brown. Tarsi brown.
FEMALE . Similar to male except for following. Variation (n=10).

Head. Length 0.74–1.06, 0.92 mm . Frons pubescence white, dense on ventral half, dorsal half dark brown, pubescence brownish gray with large, dark brown circle mediolaterally; setae white to pale yellow, elongate ventrally and dark brown dorsally. Antenna/head length 0.57–0.78, 0.67; scape length 0.16–0.26, 0.20 mm , width 0.14–0.20, 0.17 mm , length/width 1.0–1.3, 1.2, scape/pedicel length 2.0–3.3, 2.8, scape/ flagellum width 1.0–1.3, 1.0; pedicel length 0.06–0.10, 0.07 mm , width 0.12–0.18, 0.15 mm , length/width 0.33–0.71, 0.51; flagellum length 0.30–0.42, 0.35 mm , width 0.14–0.20, 0.17 mm , length/width 1.8–2.4, 2.1, flagellum/scape length 1.5–2.1, 1.8. Maxillary palpus length 0.36–0.60, 0.47 mm , width 0.08–0.10, 0.09 mm , length/width 4.4–6.2, 5.2.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3–4 np, 1–2 sa, 1–2 sc (MEI 133478 with two pairs of scutellar macrosetae). Wing. Length 5.7–7.7, 6.4 mm , width 1.7–2.7, 2.1 mm , length/width 2.8–3.4, 3.0.

Abdomen. Dark brown, pubescence gray, denser on tergites 1–4 and most of tergites 2–7, tergite 8 glossy; dorsal setae white to pale yellow appressed.
Terminalia
(MEI 170195). Furca ( Fig. 105 ) tapered posterior, anterior margin closed; length 0.42 mm , width 0.28 mm .

Immature stages.
Two males (MEI 170191–2) and 5 females (MEI 133479, 147276, 170187, 170189–90) have been reared from larvae collected on the east side of the Kleberg County line [ 27.584 , - 97.241 ], Texas
.

Distribution.
Litolinga acuta
is known from Mexico ( Tamaulipas , Veracruz ) and the United States ( Colorado , Kansas , Texas ) ( Fig. 97 ).

Habitats and Phenology.
Litolinga acuta
has been hand-netted or collected in Malaise traps and at blacklights on dunes. Adults have been collected from February through December.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Ten syntypes of
Psilocephala acuta Adams
(MEI 113834–7 ( USNM ), 140432–3 ( MCZ ), 170183–6 ( SEMC )) were examined with the following label information: MEI 113834 female ( USNM ): 1 st label: "[typeset] COTYPE". 2 nd label "[typeset]
Clark Co. Ks.
May 1962
ft. F. H. Snow ". 3 rd label: "[typeset] Collection JMAldrich". 4 th label "[handwritten in black ink] Psilocephala acuta Adams ". MEI 113835– 7 females ( USNM ): 1 st label: "[typeset] COTYPE". 2 nd label "[typeset] Clark Co. Ks.
May 1962
ft. F. H. Snow ". 3nd label: "[typeset] ALMelander Collection 1961". MEI 140432 female ( MCZ ) 1 st label: "[typeset] Clark Co. Ks.
May 1962
ft. F. H. Snow ". 2 nd label: "[typeset] Type". 3 rd label: "[red label] [typeset] Cotype No.". 4 th label: "[typeset] Collection C. W. Johnson ". MEI 140433 female ( MCZ ) 1 st label: "[typeset] Clark Co. Ks.
May 1962
ft. F. H. Snow ". 2 nd label: "[typeset] Type". 3 rd label: "[red label] [typeset] Cotype No.". 4 th label: “red label] [typeset] Type 7567. 5 th label: "[typeset] Collection C. W. Johnson ". MEI 170185 male, 170183, 170184, 170186 females ( SEMC ) 1 st label: "[typeset] Clark Co. Ks.
May 1962
ft. F. H. Snow ". 2 nd label: "[typeset] Type". The male (MEI 170185) is designated as the lectotype ( SEMC ). This lectotype is designated in order to fix the concept of
Psilocephala acuta Adams
and to ensure universal and consistent interpretation of the same. The other specimens are designated as paralectotypes . The holotype male of
Psilocephala pallida Kröber
is labeled "Texas, 19. VI." in USNM (Type No. 26018).
